title: Final Greetings and Exhortations
shortSummary: Romans 16 contains Paul's personal greetings to numerous believers and leaders in the Roman church, highlighting the unity and diversity of the early Christian community. The chapter concludes with warnings against divisive people, encouragement for faithfulness, and a doxology praising God's wisdom and power revealed through the gospel.
timeline: c. AD 57 - Paul's Epistle to the Romans, during his third missionary journey

keyCharacters.name: Phebe
keyCharacters.description: A servant of the church at Cenchreae commended by Paul for her service and assistance to many, including Paul himself.

keyCharacters.name: Priscilla and Aquila
keyCharacters.description: Paul’s helpers in Christ who risked their lives for him and hosted a church in their house.

keyCharacters.name: Andronicus and Junia
keyCharacters.description: Paul’s kinsmen and fellow prisoners, noted among the apostles and believers before Paul’s conversion.

keyCharacters.name: Tertius
keyCharacters.description: The scribe who physically wrote the epistle of Romans, greeting the recipients in the Lord.

outline.heading: Personal Greetings to Believers and Leaders
outline.description: Paul sends warm greetings to numerous individuals and house churches, acknowledging their faithfulness, service, and roles within the early church, emphasizing the importance of community and mutual support.

outline.heading: Exhortation to Avoid Divisive People
outline.description: Paul warns the Roman believers to watch out for those who cause divisions and teach contrary to the gospel, urging them to avoid such individuals who deceive others for selfish gain.

outline.heading: Encouragement to Faithfulness and God’s Victory
outline.description: Paul commends the believers’ obedience, encourages wisdom in good and innocence toward evil, and assures them of God’s ultimate victory over Satan.

outline.heading: Final Greetings and Benediction
outline.description: Paul’s coworkers send greetings, and he pronounces a blessing of grace upon the Roman believers, reinforcing the unity and fellowship among the saints.

outline.heading: Doxology and Praise to God
outline.description: The chapter closes with a powerful doxology praising God’s wisdom and power revealed through the gospel and the fulfillment of prophetic revelation for the obedience of faith among all nations.

application: Honor and support those who serve faithfully in the church, recognizing their sacrifices and contributions to the gospel.
Be vigilant against false teachers and divisive influences, maintaining sound doctrine and unity within the body of Christ.
Cultivate wisdom in doing good and maintain simplicity or innocence concerning evil to grow in spiritual maturity.
Rejoice in the assurance of God’s ultimate victory over evil and live in the grace and peace that come from Jesus Christ.

keyVerses.text: Now I beseech you, brethren, mark them which cause divisions and offences contrary to the doctrine which ye have learned; and avoid them.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores the importance of guarding the church against false teaching and maintaining doctrinal purity.

keyVerses.text: And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
keyVerses.significance: It offers encouragement and assurance of God’s power to defeat evil on behalf of His people.

keyVerses.text: Now to him that is of power to stablish you according to my gospel, and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery, which was kept secret since the world began.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God’s sovereign power in establishing believers through the gospel and the revelation of His eternal plan.

keyVerses.text: To God only wise, be glory through Jesus Christ for ever. Amen.
keyVerses.significance: The doxology affirms God’s wisdom and glory revealed through Jesus Christ, concluding the epistle with praise.
